content:
The Act titled "TMA, Abstinence Education, and QI Programs Extension Act of 2007" extends Transitional Medical Assistance (TMA) and Abstinence Education Program until December 31, 2007. It also extends the Qualifying Individual (QI) Program through December 2007. The Social Security Act amendments in December 2007 extended the total allocation amount to $100,000,000 for the period from October 1, 2007, to December 31, 2007. The amendments effective as of September 30, 2007 extend the SSI web-based asset demonstration project to the Medicaid program from October 1, 2007, to September 30, 2012, for asset eligibility determinations. The SSI web-based asset demonstration project is extended to the Medicaid program from October 1, 2007, to September 30, 2012, for asset eligibility determinations. Information from financial institutions can be shared for eligibility determinations under both programs. SEC. 5. 6-MONTH DELAY IN TAMPER-RESISTANT PRESCRIPTION PADS REQUIREMENT UNDER MEDICAID: Amends the enactment of section 7002(b) of the U.S. Troop Readiness, Veterans' Care, Katrina Recovery, and Iraq Accountability Appropriations Act, 2007 to delay the requirement from September 30, 2007, to March 31, 2008.
SEC. 6. ADDITIONAL FUNDING FOR MEDICARE PHYSICIAN ASSISTANCE AND QUALITY INITIATIVE FUND: Amends section 1848(l)(2) of the Social Security Act to allocate additional funding of $325,000,000 for 2009 and $60,000,000 for expenditures in or after 2013 to the Fund. SEC. 7. LIMITATION ON IMPLEMENTATION FOR FISCAL YEARS 2008 AND 2009 OF A PROSPECTIVE DOCUMENTATION AND CODING ADJUSTMENT IN RESPONSE TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MEDICARE SEVERITY DIAGNOSIS RELATED GROUP (MS-DRG) system. This section specifies adjustments for payment with respect to physicians' services furnished during 2009 and onwards. The implementation of the Medicare Severity Diagnosis Related Group (MS-DRG) system under the Medicare Prospective Payment System for inpatient hospital services involves applying prospective documentation and coding adjustments. The adjustments for fiscal years 2008 and 2009 are set at 0.6 percent and 0.9 percent, respectively, instead of the originally specified percentages. The Secretary may make adjustments to the Medicare Severity Diagnosis Related Group (MS-DRG) system if changes in coding and classification do not reflect real case mix differences. Adjustments may be made for discharges in fiscal years 2010-2012 to offset discrepancies. The Secretary may adjust the Medicare Severity Diagnosis Related Group (MS-DRG) system for fiscal years 2010-2012 to offset discrepancies in coding and classification that do not reflect real case mix differences. The adjustment made for discharges in a year will not affect standardized amounts in subsequent years. The Secretary is not required to adjust standardized amounts except as specified. The adjustment authority only applies to discharges in fiscal years 2010-2012. There is no judicial review of determinations or adjustments made under this subsection.
